Package org.neo4j.resources

Interface Profiler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    NullProfiler, SamplingProfiler
    public interface Profiler
    An API for profiling threads, to see where they spend their time.

    The profiler is created with the profiler() method, and is ready to use. Threads are profiled individually, and profiling is started with the profile() family of methods. Profiling can be selectively stopped by closing the returned Profiler.ProfiledInterval instance. When you are done collecting profiling data, call finish(). The finish() method must be called before the profiling data can be printed, and calling finish() will cause all on-going profiling to stop. Once the profiling has finished, the profile data can be printed with the printProfile(PrintStream, String) method.

    If you want to use the profiler again, you must call reset() before you can start profiling again.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static interface  Profiler.ProfiledInterval
      When closed, will cause the on-going profiling of a thread to be stopped.

      Finish the profiling, which includes stopping and waiting for the termination of all on-going profiles, and then prepare the collected profiling data for printing.

    • Method Detail

      • nullProfiler

        static Profiler nullProfiler()
        Returns:
        a Profiler that does not actually do any profiling.

      • profiler

        static Profiler profiler()
        Returns:
        a stack-sampling Profiler.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Reset the state of the profiler, and clear out all collected profile data.

        Call this if you want to use the profiler again, after having collected profiling data, finished profiling, and printed your profiling data.

      • countSamples

        long countSamples()
        Count the number of samples or data-points collected so far. This method may run in linear time, and the result may be out of date by the time it is returned.
        Returns:
        A non-atomic count of the number of samples or data-points collected so far.

      • setSampleIntervalNanos

        void setSampleIntervalNanos​(long nanos)
        Set the sampling interval, as the desired nanoseconds between samples.
        Parameters:
        nanos - The desired nanoseconds between profiling samples.

      • profile

        default Profiler.ProfiledInterval profile()
        Start profiling the current thread.

        The profiled thread will have its stack sampled, until either the test ends, or the returned resource is closed.

        Returns:
        A resource that, when closed, will stop the profiling of the current thread.

      • profile

        default Profiler.ProfiledInterval profile​(Thread threadToProfile)
        Start profiling the given thread.

        The profiled thread will have its stack sampled, until either the test ends, or the returned resource is closed.

        Parameters:
        threadToProfile - The thread to profile.
        Returns:
        A resource that, when closed, will stop profiling the given thread.

      • finish

        void finish()
     throws InterruptedException
        Finish the profiling, which includes stopping and waiting for the termination of all on-going profiles, and then prepare the collected profiling data for printing. This method must be called before printProfile(PrintStream, String) can be called.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the thread was interrupted while waiting for all on-going profiling activities to stop.

      • printProfile

        void printProfile​(PrintStream out,
                  String profileTitle)
        Write out a textual representation of the collected profiling data, to the given PrintStream.

        The report will start with the given profile title, and will have a "sorted sample tree" printed for each of the profiled threads.

        Parameters:
        out - the print stream where the output will be written to.
        profileTitle - the title of the profile report.

      • profile

        Profiler.ProfiledInterval profile​(Thread threadToProfile,
                                  long initialDelayNanos)
        Start profiling the given thread after the given delay in nanoseconds.

        The profiled thread will have its stack sampled, until either the test ends, or the returned resource is closed.

        Parameters:
        threadToProfile - The thread to profile.
        initialDelayNanos - The profiling will not start until after this delay in nanoseconds has transpired.
        Returns:
        A resource that, when closed, will stop the profiling of the given thread.
